title: What to Do in Key West for Labor Day Weekend

image.name: What to Do in Key West for Labor Day Weekend
image.alt: What to Do in Key West for Labor Day Weekend

post_content:
The last call for the summer season, Labor Day weekend in Key West always promises unforgettable fun and excitement. From local festivals to outdoor adventure and family fun, there are endless ways to spend your holiday weekend. Start planning your Labor Day getaway and read on to explore our favorite Labor Day weekend activities.

Key West Brewfest

August 29 – September 2

Sip and sample some of the best brews in Key West at the Labor Day classic event, Key West Brewfest. The weekend is packed with a variety of events, from beer dinners and beer brunches to pool parties and seminars. See how many of the 200 beers you can sample during your visit.

Day on the Water

Spend your long weekend out on the glimmering blue water. Whether you want to enjoy a sunset cruise around the island or opt for a view from above, enjoy a day filled with salt, sun, and endless adventure.

Beach Day 

On your Labor Day getaway, make sure to carve out some time for a lazy day on one of the pristine local beaches. From Fort Zachary Taylor Beach and Smathers Beach to the shores of Dry Tortugas, grab your beach essentials and spend the day lounging in the warm summer sun.

Family-Friendly Activities

For families visiting Key West for the holiday weekend, take advantage of one of the many local museums for a day of fun and learning. Stop by the Ernest Hemingway Home & Museum where you can spot the famous six-toed cats, or see the Key West marine life from up close at the Key West Aquarium.
